clues.text: This kids' show with a rhyming title about a guy & his pup debuted in 1996; it's probably big with your little sis
Moze & Cookie helped this title guy educate us with his "Declassified School Survival Guide"
It's the name of the Nick-TV "band" featuring Nat & Alex Wolff
This young actor won an Emmy as Louis on "Even Stevens"
Samantha & Tucker know this title Nickelodeon guy is 1/2 ghost
If you want to stand out, you can't beat the fire-engine shade of this
Of outer ear, Outer Mongolia or outer space, the one that became a Crayola color in 1998
Like the flower of the same name, buttercup is a pretty shade of this color
In the original "Wizard of Oz" book & in the musical "Wicked", the slippers aren't "ruby" but this metallic color
Puce is a perfect shade for your doggie's collar: its name is French for this pesky insect
After General Cornwallis Surrendered at Yorktown, this American traitor accompanied him back to England
This January 1, 1863 document liberated all slaves in regions still under Confederate control
In 1609 this captain was injured in a gunpowder explosion & lost his leadership role in Jamestown
The "New Deal" refers to the economic recovery & social reforms implemented by this U.S. president
In 1898 Americans were urged to "remember" this battleship that sank in Havana harbor, leading to war with Spain
The Old Barracks in this New Jersey capital housed Continental Army troops during the Revolution
The site for this capital was chosen because of its location between Pensacola & St. Augustine
In 1849 it replaced New Orleans as a state capital
At an elevation of about 7,000 feet, this city in New Mexico's Sangre de Cristo Mountains is the highest state capital
One of the 2 state capitals with "City" in their names that lie west of the Rocky Mountains
clues.response: Salt Lake City, Utah & Carson City, Nevada

clues.text: Cody the penguin & others compete in the waves off Pen Gu Island in this 2007 "major ocean picture"
Remy, a rodent who works in a Paris bistro, longs to become a chef in this animated film
20th Century Fox invited towns named Springfield to compete to host this movie's 2007 premiere
Emma Roberts stars as this title teen sleuth, new to L.A. & trying to solve the mystery of a Hollywood actress' death
Fiona's long-lost cousin Arthur is a possible heir to the throne in this 2007 sequel
The Keebler Elves could probably tell you that the name of this snack comes from a Dutch word for "small cake"
Maple or otherwise, this thick, sweet liquid is from the Arabic for "to drink"
1st used in a novel about 90 years ago, it refers to a bright person, not someone who resembles Humpty Dumpty
The name of this type of aircraft is from 2 Greek words meaning "spiral wing"
The term "funny bone" is actually a pun on the name of this upper arm bone
In a 1964 book by Louise Fitzhugh, this 6th grader spies on people & writes down her thoughts in a notebook
"The Big Honey Hunt", published in 1962, was the first in a series of books about this bear family
They are the little workers at Willy Wonka's chocolate factory
Chapters in this Katherine Paterson book include "The Giant Killers" & "Building the Bridge"
A book by George Selden related the adventures of Chester, this insect "in Times Square"
Max the dog narrates the hit musical about "How the Grinch Stole" this holiday
Ariel is the fish-tailed heroine who's tired of living "Under The Sea" in the show based on this animated movie
You could play Princess Jasmine or the genie if your school puts on the stage version of this animated 1992 film
In a 2007 musical, this fairy tale heroine wakes up & finds herself in a sleep-disorder center
The mask for this little hero of Broadway's "The Lion King" was designed without a lower jaw, like a Roman helmet
A record 73 inches of this fell on the island of Reunion in just 24 hours in 1952
In 2004, Tia, a mastiff, gave birth to the largest litter of these ever--24
At 451 feet tall, the one named for Khufu at Giza in Egypt is the tallest one of these structures in the world
At 70 years old in 2004, George Brunstad became the oldest person to swim this waterway between Britain & France
The world's largest royal family, with over 4,000 princes, is the Al-Saud family of this Mideast country
Some say his 12 labors were penance for killing his wife Megara & their children
Jupiter is the Roman equivalent of this Greek god
She was given a box & told not to open it; she did, releasing the world's evils, but shut it before Hope could escape
This Greek sea god could cause springs to flow & create storms with a flourish of his trident
The subject of a huge statue, this monster on the road to Thebes ate people who could not answer its riddle
"She sells sea shells" at this location
"In Hertford, Hereford & Hampshire" these windy storms "hardly ever happen"
These animals "shouldn't sleep in a shack", these animals "should sleep in a shed"
"The sawingest saw I ever saw saw was the saw I saw saw in" this "Land of Opportunity State"
One of these animals "sat on a stump & thunk the stump stunk"
The dad of this 2006 British Open winner was the 1st African-American baseball player in the then-Big 7 conference
Now with Miami, at age 24, this 7'1", 325-lb. guy was the youngest man on the NBA's "50 Greatest Players" list
In 2006 this team's David Ortiz was wicked excellent with 54 HRs & 137 RBIs
The jersey of the Houston Rockets' Tracy McGrady was China's top seller in 2005; this teammate & center was 3rd
In 1997 this QB led the Packers to a 35-21 Super Bowl win vs. the Patriots; as of 2007, he was still their QB

rounds.text: There's news of the first lab test for this 10-letter condition the NIH calls the leading cause of disability for Americans 15 to 44
